content.description: Sit start low with your hands matched in the horizontal crack. Follow good holds straight up.
content.location: It is on the block just right of Troglodyte.

content.description: Start with your left hand as for Troglodyte but your right hand already up on the low part of the right arete between the two boulders. Climb as for Troglodyte, but the rocks to the right are on for your feet. The crux is the mantel as for Troglodyte.

Start on an undercling at the back of the cave. Find a way up to the opposing aretes. Pull up compression features, and figure out a tricky mantel. The disconnected blocks to the right are off for hands and feet. This is very beta intensive.
content.location: It is in the left side of the cave on the obvious undercling feature down low.

content.description: Climb the overhung prow. Start on the lowest of the obvious, jutting edges. Climb straight up through an overhung edge with a small crimp and your thumb on the arete. The crux is a right hand move up to a pinch on the right side of the face. Continue through a couple more moves, and then top out at the highest point.
content.location: It is on a small overhung boulder up the hillside from the Warm Up Cave. Looking straight up the hill, opposite from the trail, and you should be able to see this boulder about fifty meters away.

content.description: Welcome Cave has a couple good easy and moderate climbs on comfortable landings just a two minute hike from the car.
